Dating: 1ST INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before); 9TH & 10TH DYNASTY; MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Offering table
Description: Offering table carved in limestone, with simple forms and sharp incision. It is rectangular, with a cavity to receive water libations. It comes from Herakleopolis Magna, from the First Intermediate Period/ Middle Kingdom cemetery. It must have been placed in front of a false door stela, but it was found out of its original context. Its owner is unknown since it does not hold any inscription.
